To apply to KNUST, prospective students need to purchase an eVoucher and then follow these steps:

1. Visit the KNUST online admissions portal at https://apps.knust.edu.gh/admissions/apply/Account/Login
2. Enter the eVoucher credentials to access the application form.
3. Carefully complete all sections of the application, ensuring all required fields marked with an asterisk are filled.
4. Save your progress as you go. You can exit and return to the application later if needed.
5. Provide your educational background, including details of your previous schools and certificates. If your specific institution is not listed, you can choose the "Private" option.
6. Enter your examination results accurately. If your examination type isn't listed, select "Certification/Diploma/Degree." For the sitting, select "May/June (School)" if your exam wasn't WASSCE/SSSCE. Choose the correct year and input your Index Number (Candidate Number or Examination ID).
7. Select the subjects you took and input the corresponding grades. If you're awaiting results, choose the "Awaiting" option. For other certificates, input the grade/class accordingly. You can add multiple results or certificates as needed.
8. Upload all required documents in PDF format. These typically include your birth certificate and results slips or certificates.
9. Carefully read and agree to the applicant declaration.
10. Select your program choices, indicating your preferred stream (e.g., Regular). You can also indicate if you'd like to be considered for fee-paying options.
11. Upload a copy of your identification document (Ghana Card or Passport) in PDF format.
12. Review all information thoroughly before proceeding.
13. Agree to the final declaration confirming the accuracy of your application.
14. Submit your application and keep a copy for your reference.

Important Notes:

* Do not leave your application inactive for more than 5 minutes, as this will log you out.
* You can edit your application multiple times until the deadline.
* Review the specific entry requirements for your desired program to ensure you meet the criteria.
* Applicants with international high school qualifications may need to have their certificates evaluated by the Ghana Tertiary Commission (GTEC) or an equivalent international credential evaluation agency.
* Opting for the fee-paying option applies to the entire duration of your program of study.

If you have further questions or require clarification, feel free to contact the KNUST admissions office for assistance.

patterns: what are the requirements for hospitality management?
responses:
• WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects:
     Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects:
     Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from any of the following groups:
    Business, General Arts, General Science, and Vocational/Home Economics.


  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level:
     Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics.

    'A' Level or equivalent:
     Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects in General Arts, Business, and General Science.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • An applicant should be at least 25 years at the time of submitting the application.
    • An applicant must satisfy the requirement for either 'A' Level or WASSCE/SSSCE with credit passes in THREE (3) Elective Subjects in Business, General Arts, General Science, and Vocational/Home Economics.
    • Short-listed Applicants shall take an entrance examination and pass an interview.

  • OTHER APPLICANTS
    • General Business Certificate (GBCE) and/or Advanced Business Certificate (ABCE):
      • Credit passes in at least SIX (6) subjects including English Language and Business Mathematics at the GBCE, or
      • Credit passes in the THREE (3) relevant Compulsory Subjects and THREE (3) Optional Subjects at the ABCE.
      • Applicants need both GBCE and ABCE to qualify.

    • ACCA, ICA, ACIB or CIM:
      • Credit passes at WASSCE/SSSCE in THREE (3) Core Subjects and THREE Electives OR,
      • FIVE (5) credit passes at the 'O' Level including English Language and Mathematics. Applicants in this category are admitted into year one.

    • HND with Second Class (Lower Division) and above:
      • Credit passes at WASSCE/SSSCE in THREE (3) Core subjects and THREE (3) Electives OR,
      • FIVE (5) credit passes at 'O' level including English language and mathematics. These applicants would be placed in either Year Two (2) or Year Three (3) after passing an entrance examination/interview.

responses:
KNUST provides six halls of residence for student accommodation: Queen Elizabeth II Hall, Unity Hall, Independence Hall, Republic Hall, University Hall, and Africa Hall. These halls accommodate both male and female students.

In addition to the halls of residence, there are numerous privately-owned hostels around the KNUST campus. You can find a list of recommended hostels on the KNUST website at:

* [www.knust.edu.gh/students/housing](www.knust.edu.gh/students/housing)
* [www.knust.edu.gh/index.php/students/recommended-hostels-20202021-academic-year](www.knust.edu.gh/index.php/students/recommended-hostels-20202021-academic-year)

For hostel fees, visit the hostel websites or contact them directly. The fee schedule for traditional halls is available on the KNUST website.

Kumasi has a tropical climate with an average temperature of 75°F (24°C). You can expect a rainy season from March to July, and a relatively dry season from August to February. I recommend bringing light clothing for the warm weather and an umbrella or raincoat.
To find the cost of accommodation, do well to check the fee schedule for the price of traditional halls. For hostels, do well to visit their website or contact them for the current prices.

patterns: do you have scholarship opportunities for students?
responses:
KNUST offers various scholarship opportunities for brilliant but needy students to enable them to pursue university education. Some of these include the Edu Fondazione Scholarship, Hulede Foundation KNUST Scholarship, and Educational Pathways International Scholarships.

In addition to these, there are other grants and bursaries available to support students financially. You can also explore external scholarship opportunities.

I advise you to carefully review the requirements for each scholarship as they vary. For detailed information on available scholarships for KNUST students, please visit www.knust.edu.gh/students/scholarships-and-grants.
